description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, Kate chose to play option 2.John chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -5000.
John can deviate from his default action (option 1) to retaliate or adapt, likely triggered by Kate’s prior defection
Mutual defection (option 2) incurs catastrophic penalties (e.g., -5000 for input=5), incentivizing coordination to avoid it
The OpenAI model (John) may prioritize short-term retaliation over long-term payoff optimization, as mutual defection harms both players
High input values amplify risks of defection, making trust critical to avoid mutually destructive outcomes
The game resembles a volatile Prisoner’s Dilemma, where defection risks extreme losses, requiring strategic foresight to balance exploitation and cooperation
